briefTitle: Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Zonisamide in the Treatment of Partial Seizures

outcomeMeasures.title: Median Percent Change From Baseline in All Partial Seizure Frequency (Complex Partial Seizures (CP)+ Simple Partial Seizures (SP) + Secondary Generalization Seizures (SGS)) During the Fixed-dose Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: The median percent change in seizure frequency of all partial seizures (CP+SP+SGS) from baseline during the fixed-dose phase.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Complex Partial (CP) Seizure Frequency
outcomeMeasures.description: The Mean Percent Change in seizure frequency of CP from baseline during the fixed-dose phase.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Simple Partial (SP) Seizure Frequency
outcomeMeasures.description: The Mean percent change in seizure frequency of SP from baseline during the fixed-dose phase.

outcomeMeasures.title: The Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Partial Seizures With Secondary Generalization (SGS)
outcomeMeasures.description: The mean percent change in seizure frequency of SGS from baseline during the fixed-dose phase.

outcomeMeasures.title: Responder Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Responder rate is defined as percentage of participants with \>=50% reduction in seizure frequency from baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Number of Seizure Free Days
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean number of seizure free days per 28 day period during fixed dose phase

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Percentage of Change in Seizure Free Days
Mean Time to First Seizure (Days)
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean time to first seizure during fixed dose phase

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Seizure-free Participants During Fixed-dose Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of seizure-free participants during fixed-dose phase

outcomeMeasures.title: Drop - Out Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of Participants who dropped out of the study. In the Study drop-out rate is defined as number of participants.
